name: Buttermilk Pancakes II
author: BURYGOLD
summary: A very light and fluffy pancake that requires fresh buttermilk, but it's the best I've ever made!
directions: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt
In a separate bowl, beat together buttermilk, milk, eggs and melted butter
Keep the two mixtures separate until you are ready to cook
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat
You can flick water across the surface and if it beads up and sizzles, it's ready! Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture, using a wooden spoon or fork to blend
Stir until it's just blended together
Do not over stir! Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/2 cup for each pancake
Brown on both sides and serve hot
